text:
In this video, you’ll learn about updating to 
AWS Control Tower landing zone version 3.0.

With this version, you can enable 
organization-level AWS CloudTrail trails,

utilize expanded Region 
deny guardrail features,

and reduce the amount of 
AWS Config resources needed.

From the AWS Control Tower dashboard,
let’s start by opening the Landing zone settings.

We’ll select version number 
3.0 and initiate the update.

The first step-to update 
Region settings-is optional.
Let’s move on to step 2.

The version 3.0 update introduces an 
optional configuration that reorganizes

your organization’s AWS CloudTrail trails from 
account-based into organization-based trails.

If you enable this configuration, AWS 
Control Tower creates an organization-

level CloudTrail trail and aggregates logs
into your organization’s existing Amazon

Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) 
bucket associated with Control Tower.

Enabling this feature will replace any account-
level trails provisioned by AWS Control Tower;

however, you are responsible for 
eliminating any other account-level trails

and re-establishing the file paths for 
third-party logging tools if necessary.

Let’s confirm the 
acknowledgement and proceed.

Here, we can review our choices and 
then choose to update our landing zone.
For now, let’s return to the previous page.

If you opt out of organization-level 
CloudTrail trails, AWS Control Tower will
stop managing your AWS CloudTrail trails.

Control Tower will delete your 
account-level trails, although logging

data already in the specified 
Amazon S3 bucket will stay intact.

Also, Control Tower will 
not create any new trails,

though your organization can 
create and manage trails on its own.

To proceed, we must 
acknowledge these terms.

We must also enter text stating 
that we want to STOP ALL TRAILS.
Let’s confirm and move on.

Now we’ll review our selections 
and update the landing zone.

Landing zone version 3.0 also expands
the AWS Control Tower Region deny

guardrail to include additional AWS
Chatbot, Amazon S3 Storage Lens,
and Amazon S3 Multi-Region Access Points APIs.

The Region deny guardrail assists you 
in limiting access to AWS services and

operations for enrolled accounts 
in your Control Tower environment.

This helps ensure that any customer 
data you upload to AWS services

is located only in the AWS 
Regions that you specify.

Further, landing zone 3.0 now records
global resources in home Regions only.

This configuration creates cost savings 
by reducing the number of configuration

items created when global resources 
are created, modified, or deleted.

You’ve just learned about updating to AWS 
Control Tower Landing Zone version 3.0.

You can learn more about this topic in 
the description and links for this video.
Thanks for watching. Now it's your turn to try.
